triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: The paper employs adaptive control methods to handle unknown nonlinear functions and system uncertainties.

triples.name: Radial basis function network
triples.relevance: RBF neural networks are specifically used to approximate unknown nonlinear functions in the control system.

triples.name: Lyapunov function
triples.relevance: Lyapunov function method is the theoretical foundation for proving system stability and convergence.

triples.name: Nonlinear system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of nonaffine nonlinear multiagent systems, a key problem domain.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper specifically addresses multiagent systems where followers must converge to leader output.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the fundamental theoretical framework for the entire control protocol design.

triples.name: Closed-loop controller
triples.relevance: The paper designs a closed-loop event-triggered control protocol for multiagent systems.

triples.name: System identification
triples.relevance: Adaptive parameter estimation is used to handle unknown system dynamics and unmodeled dynamics.

triples.name: Neural network
triples.relevance: Neural networks are the core technique for approximating nonlinear functions in the control system.

triples.name: Event-triggered architecture
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel event-triggered control protocol with a varying threshold to reduce communication burden.
